inn1.comm: slight inswing but still beat Vincent and a half-hearted appeal for one going down the leg and also a bit high
gentle away-swing outside off stump, left alone
on off stump, correct defensive stroke
again a good line and Vincent has to defend once more
outside off stump and a momentary worry for Pollock that could be called a wide
pushed to extra cover for what would have been a tight single but Dippenaar stumbled and completely missed the ball and a scrambled one became an easy three
quick, on off stump, steered to cover
overpitched and driven in the air well over mid off and three bounces over the rope
leg-side, would have been a wide but it clipped the pad on the way through and well taken by a diving Boucher
attempted a repeat of two balls earlier but it came off the toe of the bat and ran down to the man at deep backward point
seamed away from Fleming and he shouldered arms
on leg stump, sweetly flicked square for four all along the ground
defensive push to mid on
Vincent gave Pollock the charge and missed an attempted drive. He has made it clear he is going to attack everything
jagged back and loud appeal as it struck a jumping Vincent in front ... looked too high and the umpire thought so
guided to point with an angled bat

well forward, struck outside the line, loud appeal and a scampered leg-bye to extra cover. The bat was barely close to playing a shot and there has to be  a question as to whether he even played a shot
a good line and blocked by Fleming
on the button and Vincent played a solid defensive shot with bat and pad jammed together
forward and a quick single into the leg side as the pace had been taken off the ball
seven men on the off side and Ntini spears it in on the leg side
plopped to extra cover
driven in the air high over the covers and it just about beats the fielders to the rope. It was very uppish but he's clearly going to go after anything pitched in his half
driven to mid off
Left alone ... Fleming has only faced five balls so far
attempted push off the back foot but gets an inside edge and the ball bounces close to his off stump on the way through to Boucher
good line but overstepped
driven square through a small gap in the covers
another drive but this time doesn't find the gap
one step down the track but his cross-batted heave goes straight to midwicket
slower ball outside off stump deceives Fleming
straight ball, no room for Vincent to do much with that
short of a length and seemed to pick up pace off the pitch and through Vincent's defensive push
loud and confident shout as the ball zips past his outside edge. Replays show the ball missed the bat but his bat did brush the pad. Good decision.
leg-stump line, blocked
textbook drive but straight to mid off
pulled from outside off stump between midwicket and mid on with real venom
nice cricket, took the pace off the ball with a dead bat and a quick run. Good understanding between the batsmen made that easy when it could have been a bit frantic
slightly shorter on off stump and Vincent cramped for room
flicked off middle-and-leg but straight to the man on 45 saving the one

the plan works! Vincent goes on the back foot, plays across the line and his middle stump is knocked back. He had looked to get forward whenever possible. First Pollock cramped him by bowling a tight line, and so prevented him using his arms, and then Boucher came up to the stumps to stop him using his feet
flicked to midwicket
beaten outside off stump
punched through the covers for four. The fielder would have expected to stop that but it kicked slightly off an artificial wicket which didn't help
left alone outside off stump
again left alone but close enough to off stump for the bowler to give a snort of frustration
inside edge into pads attempting a drive
driven with an angled bat to the right of midwicket from outside off stump
driven gently into the covers
punched to extra cover, a momentary thought of a single from Astle but Fleming not interested
good run, again the pace taken off the ball as it plopped to midwicket allowing a scurried single
overpitched, sweetly driven from middle-and-off wide of mid on
wristily turned square into the gap on the leg side
tried to cut but too cramped and Astle not able to get any power into the shot
Astle tried to make room but Pollock saw him coming and bowled into his body
wide of off stump, Fleming misses an attempted cut and, surpise, Nel pulls a face
better line, better shot
driven behind square on the off but straight to Dippenaar
a more confident drive but once again to the fielder
a repeat of the previous ball. A good first over from Nel, on the spot and backed by sound fielding
leg side, well stopped rather than taken by Boucher
another good run to one hit to extra cover with soft hands. The running so far has been excellent
angled to short third man. Rare width from Pollock
on off stump, Astle is looking to give room and punch the ball away off the back foot but Pollock bowling a tight line
slower ball, scrambled the seam and almost did for Astle
short, pulled to the right of square leg but he could only half stop the ball and the ricochet went into space
proded into the off side
swing and a miss, angled across the lefthander and cutting back into him - kept a touch too low and Fleming misses out here
cutting back again into the lefthander but he gets some bat on it this time, pushing it out into the covers
too short from Nel and Fleming simply paddles this effortlessly around the corner to a vacant fine leg. Fine shot
oh no, too straight again from Nel and Fleming glances this down to fine-leg once more - much finer than the previous ball
pushed to mid-on but no real power
jaffa! Ridiculous shot, mind; right on the money from Hall, just outside the offstump and swinging away just a hint. Astle tries to hit it into the Indian Ocean and misses spectacularly
that's more like it, wider from Hall and short enough for Astle to give him the charge, crashing it over cover for four
oooh he's creamed this one - a lovely, flowing cover drive for four, all along the turf. Beautifully struck
straying down the legside onto Astle's pad
without moving his feet Astle thick-edges this down to third man...typically Astle
outside off but short of a length and not driveable; Astle clubs it, or toe-ends it, into the covers
oooh blimey, there's Astle going bananas again. A monstrous and decidedly ugly heave across the line and Nel wonders where his luck has gone. He's utterly fuming
tapped into the gully but no run
well bowled! Swinging back into Astle who is trapped on the crease and leaves his bat out to dry. Very close indeed, as evidenced by Nel's wry grin
this is fine bowling, Nel's found his line now. Outside off and swinging back into Astle
pushed into the covers
down the legside, a gimme for four but Boucher dives and collects Fleming's wristy thick-edge
a slower ball, Fleming comes forward to defend - more of an indecisive prod, really - and edges it short of the wicketkeeper
fine shot but the wrong line from Hall; too straight, allowing Fleming to whip it fine for four with consummate ease
oh shot! Fleming's nearing his best here, late-cutting this with great power past point for four.
Another slower-ball which Fleming mistimes into the covers
better line and length forcing the batsman forward
short and wide but Astle can't get on top of it, clubbing it to point
tries to get this through the gap, times it neatly into the covers but it's a fine stop from Smith
ooh where's this gone? It's flicked off his legs in front of square, without great power but he's timed it beautifully and it sails over the infield for four.&
better line outside Fleming's offstump who is cramped for room, punching it to point
good ball, good line, good length - good allround, and defended neatly by Fleming. Good cricket, in fact.
now that's more like it from Nel, finding some spice in that delivery which spat away from the lefthander who fended awkwardly at it.
cramped for room and chopped down into the covers
got him! Astle loses his head, and his stumps, as Hall pitches this right up and Astle, making room for himself, is beaten by a really well-directed yorker.
great line, Marshall comes forward to defend solidly
drifting down the legside and Marshall neatly whips it off his legs down to fine-leg
very full and drifting down leg, Boucher dives to collect
better line outside the offstump this time and Fleming defends.
rapped on the pad but Fleming's big stride has saved him. Big throaty roar from Hall and the slips but the umpire, Mark Benson, shakes his&
outside off, Marshall jumps back into his crease and defends off the back foot
identical line and Marshall mirrors his previous shot, pushing it out into the covers
outside off and cutting back into the righthander this time. Marshall misreads the movement and is almost cut in half, the ball sailing through to Boucher
gone! Got him! This is fine bowling from Nel. He set Marshall up the previous three balls, just moving the ball ever so slightly back into the righthander and this time Marshall plays on.
sways out of the way of this one
down the legside and Nel, predictably, roars his annoyance.
leaves this one alone outside the offstump
outside Fleming's offstump who watchfully leaves it alone
the wrong line, drifting down the legside and Fleming whips it away...but only for a single
yorker-length, driven back to the bowler
outside the offstump and Fulton gets off the mark with a gentle guide down to third man
so close! Fleming is cramped for room and nearly chops this onto his stumps, very close indeed
yorker-length and dug out by the batsman
watchfully left alone by the righthander outside his offstump
thick-edged down to third-man just for a single. Good line from Nel, though, teasing the batsman
down the legside and Fleming rather misses out here. They scamper through for a single
shoulders arms outside the offstump
again he shoulders arms and this one jags back to the righthander
a dibbly-dobbly floater which eventually arrives on Fleming's middle-stump. Defended watchfully
pushed into the covers and they think about a single, but Fulton rightly sends his skipper back
defended off the back foot into the covers. Better pace from Kallis this time, and a more aggressive line
cleverly angled off the back foot down to third man - a "touch" shot
lovely, elegant drive for no run
and he's gone! Kallis picks up a wicket in his first over, on his birthday too. The bouncer and Fulton spoons it to Boucher - he really should have left that alone.
and he gets immediate turn into the lefthander, plays it neatly into the legside
played off the back foot to the legside for a quick single
Fleming goes back and turns this into forward short-leg's hands
fuller and Fleming times this out into the deep
slower - 50mph - and Fleming plays-and-misses. Peterson roars the most unlikely of appeals
pushed out into the covers
driven powerfully but straight to long-off
angling into the batsman who, off the back foot, tries to cut but gets into a complete tangle. Nevertheless they scamper through for a sprightly single
excellent length from Kallis; Oram really ought to have been forward to this one, his ungainly poke off the back foot could have gone anywhere.
shoulders arms outside the offstump
guided down to third man
he sweeps, gets a bottom-edge to Boucher who roars an appeal. Replays suggest he edged it into the ground first, not the boot as the South Africans thought it might have
misreads the flight and it's ballooned out into the covers
oh dear, not sure Oram really knows what he's doing here. Tries to improvise by paddling it fine but somehow spoons the ball to point
nurdled for a single
crisply driven through the covers, but long-off runs 20 yards to save four and limit them to just a couple
defended off the back foot
nudged down to third man and there's his fifty
punched down the ground, but no run on offer there
slower ball which the batsman reads, and it's clunked out into the covers
another slower ball and Oram can't quite time it as well as he'd like, turning it to the legside
ooh and he fishes at this - horrible shot. Oram looks in no form whatsoever, Kallis angling this one away from the lefthander
oh but that's a superb shot, crashing Kallis through extra cover for a commanding boundary
on the button
punched up to long on for a strolled single
turned to short midwicket
missed reverse sweep, flew to slip but off his pads

A strangley low-key dismissal. Oram was caught on the crease playing a defensive push, a thin edge into his pads looped high and short leg ambled in to take the catch. Barely an appeal and Oram departs
slightly quicker but met with the full face of the bat
pushed wide enough of short midwicket to allow a scampered single to mid on
left alone by  McCullum outside off stump and the ball  shot along the ground and through Boucher's legs for four byes. The bounce did for him but his technique was slightly at fault
half stopped by short extra cover - he did well to take the pace off the ball
paddled into the covers
Fleming plays a typical one-day shot, opening the face and guiding the ball behind square on the off
flicked to midwicket
overpitched and driven to mid-on halfway back
a touch short but pace hurried the batsmen
blocked
defensive push to straight one
overpitched and driven wide of mid-on halfway back, thoughts of a second but a good pick-up and throw put paid to that
wide of a diving short midwicket
pushed drive into the gap between cover and extra cover. Nice placement from a player well set
patted back to the bowler
take that! McCullum spotted the short one early, leant back and hammered it to the midwicket boundary with interest. On this pitch the ball just sits up and begs to be belted
good response from Kallis, back in the groove
fuller length but kept a tad low and McCullum, who was back, had to jab down on it
too much width and comfortably steered behind square on the off
looked to work it into the leg side and missed it
this time did connect and ran it through the vacant mid-on position
solid defensive push
bounce surprised him but it hit high on the bat and that took the pace off ... it rolled into the covers and they took a single
on the spot to end the over
looped up and blocked
McCullum tries to use the feet and hit with the spin but it is clipped to midwicket
no chance of anything there
McCullum gives himself room and cuts behind square, Dippenaar makes a great stop on the rope
arm ball which McCullum has to reach for
McCullum waits and turns the ball behind square on the leg where the fielder is waiting
floated, played into the leg side
short, shaped to cut, but bounced too much and he thwacked it into the ground
driven to long off
turned into the covers for an easy one
again Peterson gives too much width and it's hammered through the covers to the man on the boundary
McCullum uses his feet and a quick first run to long on makes a second possible
defensive prod
again uses his feet but misses it and it squirts off his pads
feigns to come down the track, Smith drops it short and McCullum pulls to the midwicket boundary
beaten by the spin
and beaten again. That turned quite a bit away from the left hander
overpitched, launched safely over mid on where the man had come in off the boundary
driven to long off
too wide and smacked through the covers. It should have been one but Ntini in the deep fumbled and they came back. Sloppy
cautious defence
a bit more flight and McCullum early on the shot which was a drive back firmly to Peterson's right and the bowler takes a good tumbling catch
short and wide, Fleming reached and cut square
prodigious turn and Vettori left groping
dabbed behind square on the off
reached and swept to backward square leg, all controlled
tip and run into the covers
too short, and Fleming had time to steer into the gap on the off side
South Africa happy to allow the single to long on
very wristy flick wide of midwicket
turned into Fleming and he was too cramped to work it away
far too short on a pitch of this pace, and Fleming waited before launching it through the vacant square-leg region
comfortably placed into the gap on the leg side
worked behind square on the leg. Vettori thought of a second but Fleming not interested
swept off the toe-end and Dippenaar dives to stop the four
tossed up and turned
Cut ever-so fine and beat the man on the 45 saving one
premeditated sweep for a single
flighted but controlled drive to long on
another attempted sweep but so far outside off stump it is called a wide
and that was even wider. Smith trying to prevent Vettori sweeping

well, well. That was on course to being a third wide but Vettori tried to cut the ball fine and only succeeded it running the ball off the face of the bat straight into Boucher's gloves. He really had to reach to even get something on that one
angled down to third man. Franklin had five to face
prodded into the covers off the back foot and a misfield allows him to get off the mark
driven off the back foot to the man out on the cover boundary
Franklin shouldered arms and the ball clipped him in front of middle and off and yet no-one appealed ... aside from a couple in the office!  Many appeals have come from ones not as close as that
clipped to leg for a single
driven to the man at long on but he has come in a few yards and so prevents the single
turned a mile to beat Franklin's prod. Surely he needs a slip to add to the pressure?
tried to flick to leg but got a leading edge and it looped safely into the covers
blocked with ease
turned past Fleming's outside edge once more
Fleming used his feet, missed it and Boucher fumbled the take with Fleming possibly still out of his ground. In fairness to Boucher, the turn and variable bounce makes this far from easy
at last Fleming finds the gap
a bit lucky. Fleming played a back-foot pull which went high but into space and it plugged short of the rope at long on
guided to the fielder at point
punched through the gap in the covers to the man out deep
solid defence back to Ntini
paddled into the covers and Franklin happy to leave Fleming on strike
well flighted, turning away from the left hander who pokes at it ungainly. Well beaten there
swept hard to deep midwicket but just for a single
nicely flighted on offstump and neatly defended on the front foot
launches this sweep shot through midwicket to the man in the deep
too wide, fired down the legside - Boucher does well to prevent it going for four
Fleming reaches for this outside his off stump and sweeps through midwicket
cracking shot lofting it over cover's head for a resounding four. No shortage of elegance and poise from Franklin there
pushed out into the covers
slightly squared up by one which cuts back into him, but Franklin played it neatly, angling it down to third man right at the last moment
down the leg side and pushed off his pads for a single
oh he's got him! Kallis fires in a bouncer which Franklin can't quite cope with, spooning the ball off his elbow and onto the stumps. He was looking quite settled, Franklin, too.
down the leg side. The batsman misses it, the wicketkeeper does too and it's five deliciously free runs for New Zealand
a solid drive to mid-off
outside the off stump, kept a touch low and it's pushed out into the covers
outside the off stump and Fleming is beaten once again
crikey, that turned some - so much that Fleming ignores it
outside off, Fleming rocks back and cuts it without great power or timing
too short from Smith allowing Fleming to go back and pull it through midwicket
turned to short fine-leg, but no run on offer there
pushes this slightly wider of the man at short fine-leg and they scamper a single
carved down to third man; a foot either side of him and that would've been four
driven on the up through extra cover - looks like he toe-ended that one - and it's collected by the man out in the deep
spooned in the air - could have gone anywhere - into midwicket for a single
a touch quicker from Kallis, it rushes onto the batsman who turns it away for a single
oh, what a way to go - a leg-side drifter picked up and lofted straight down to Pollock at fine-leg who didn't need to move a muscle. End of a really fine innings in sapping conditions
defended solidly
pushed back to the bowler
swept from outside the off stump to fine-leg
straighter ball which turns prodigiously
pushed back to mid-on
slightly shorter and Patel pulls it, without the necessary power, to a deep midwicket
"ow-wozzat?" asks Smith as Patel is hit on the pad...but he's well outside the line
cracking delivery! Sped onto the right hander, bounced and turned
flicked off the back foot to mid-on
nudged around the corner for a single
pushed to Pollock at short third-man, they scamper a single - oh dear, this is curtains for New Zealand and Pollocks fires in a throw, hits the stumps and replays confirm Patel's fate

inn2.comm: left alone outside the off stump
don't bowl there...it's on his pads and Smith whips it away
a touch of swing there for the bowler and the Dippenaar comes forward to defend
Dippenaar goes for an expansive Caribbean-style back-foot clobber, but can only jab it meekly into the ground
got him! There's the breakthrough for New Zealand as Dippenaar is trapped in front to one which angled in and just straightened a touch.
good line from Mills again, curving away from Gibbs ever so slightly and forcing the batsman to adjust at the last minute
shoulders arms to an away-swinger which curved gently towards first slip
straighter, pushed off his pads to midwicket who fumbled it and allowed them through for a single
floated up to his pads and driven down the ground but without any power or timing
jaffa - really well bowled, enticing Smith forward into the drive before the swing takes the ball away. Comprehensively beaten
clunked down the ground
outside off stump and pushed into the gully

GONE! That's a cracker, an absolute gem from Mills angling into Gibbs and creeping through his forward defence, plucking the off-bail. Terrific length in particular, dragging the batsman forward and there was just enough movement off the pitch to beat the bat
and immediately Kallis is watchful in defence, waiting for the swing and ignoring it
oooh that's another fine delivery from Mills, angling into the right hander who is forced to adjust his stroke, edging it past gully
and he goes past the left hander's off stump this time
half a throaty appeal for lbw but it's outside the line
crashed off the back foot but straight to cover
off the back foot, Kallis inside-edges this past his stumps and not far from McCullum's left glove. Very fortunate
squared up - touch more bounce there this time for Franklin - and Kallis again adjusts his stroke to play it down by his feet
swinging away from the right hander
Kallis comes forward this time to defend with the straightest of bats
slightly slower and wider from Franklin and Kallis leaves it well alone. No need to play at those
ooh that'll be close, Kallis is rapped on the pad but...Franklin has overstepped. Well, it would have been close
a scampered and fraught single to mid-on
ooh Kallis threatens to play at this; he came forward to defend then, at the very last minute, withdrew his bat. More swing for Mills away from the right hander
wider of the crease this time and angling into Kallis who defends off the back foot
again wider of the crease and pitched a touch wider too, Kallis - clearly wary of the swing - spoons it down to third man
straighter ball, less swing and Smith pushes it back to the bowler
a round-arm drive, which ought to have gone to long-off, ended up at third man. Quick scampered single
defended with a clunk of the bat
a puff of dust there and yet more bounce for Franklin. Smith plays it off the back foot and looks surprised at the spitting delivery
Smith makes the charge and takes a pace down the pitch, before pushing it back to the bowler
defended on the front foot
hammered hard back to the bowler who lunges out his left hand and does well to stop it. Ouch.
Smith comes forward and defends...but Franklin has overstepped
ooh excellent delivery, swinging into the left hander and Smith inside-edges it onto his pad
on-driven neatly but only for a single
ah the curse of the commentator, as Smith drives ungainly without moving his feet whatsoever, and the ball misses his stumps by an inch or less.
wisely shoulders arms and leaves this alone
nudged off his legs. Smith will do that all day, all tournament, and they pick off two
driven in the air past mid-on - it was in the air for quite some time, but such was the timing that it sailed clear of any danger and rocketed for four
slower delivery, Smith is wise to it though and defends
down the leg side, Smith misses out here and it passes through to the wicketkeeper
defended off the back foot with a high left elbow
goes on the front foot this time, Kallis, pushing it out into the covers
driven with greater force but straight to mid-off
a flourishing drive but Kallis gets an inside edge which flies down to fine-leg
Smith smacks this on-the-up, but again he can't find the gap
Smith comes down the pitch, nudges it to the leg side but again can't find a gap

GONE! Great catch, that's a blinder from Mills and Kallis trudges off shaking his head. Kallis pushes at it back to Mills who, in his follow-through, throws out his right arm taking it behind him. He even had the awareness to roll, not fall, onto the pitch to prevent it bobbling out. Huge wicket, and a memorable half-an-hour for Mills
wide of the off stump and left alone by Boucher
angling into Boucher who chips it to mid-on
fantastic stop from Patel at square leg. Boucher pulled it with immense power off the meat of the bat and Patel dived full length and, with two hands, clamped down on it
another big puff of dust and Boucher is cautious, wary of the pitch, pushing forward without conviction
squared up a touch, defended back to the bowler
Boucher stays back in his crease and defends, but he's rushed into his stroke
just a touch slower and swinging away, Boucher fishes and wishes he hadn't
ooh Boucher's in trouble again, defending it with just one hand on the bat. Not convincing.
driven past the bowler, mid-off dives to save two - and does well

driven through the covers with great power, it's racing for four but Vettori shows no sign of the back injuries that have plagued his career, diving like a teenager on alcopops and saving four on the boundary. Superb bit of fielding.
solidly defended on the front foot
well wide of the off stump and Smith's eyes light up, crashing it through the covers but straight to the fielder
turned off his legs and Patel dives, and makes a hash of what should've been a simple piece of fielding
OOOH close, Smith spoons this back to Mills and it lands just short! This is terrific energy from Mills
great bowling, another slower ball and it's defended on the front foot
carved off the back foot, that was hit like a tracer but Marshall cuts it off with another fine save in the covers
driven with a crisp clunk of the bat to mid-off
oh he's crashed this one too; these are making a lovely, crisp, clunk off the bat but again he can't find the gap
Smith charges down the pitch again, but can only defend it
outside off stump and defended on the front foot. No great pace there from Oram
down the pitch and carved over the covers for four. Fine shot
ah super shot that, nudging it off his legs with perfect timing
squirted down to third man
defended with the straightest of bats, head right over the ball
angled off the back foot down to third man
slower ball which Boucher tries to turn around the corner, misses and it bobbles through to the wicketkeeper. Poor stroke on this pitch
much fuller from Franklin this time, allowing Boucher to drive but he can't quite time it
short of a length and Boucher picks it up over midwicket
pushed down to third man
driven straight to extra cover
driven without timing to mid-off
good looking drive, with a flourish, through the covers but again the pitch is two-paced and it's proving difficult for the batsmen to time
good ball, slower and a touch shorter, but Boucher reads it and defends with a straight bat
outside the off stump and in the corridor of uncertainty, Boucher goes back to defend
turned off his legs to a short square-leg who prevents the single

Gone! He's out of here and Boucher shakes his head. It was a dreadful stroke, slashing at a wide one. You really can't slash like that in these circumstances, and he gets a bottom-edge through to the wicketkeeper
short and nudged through the gap where slip would be
paddled into the covers for a single to bring Kemp onto strike for the first time
driven gently off the front foot back to the bowler
plopped into the covers
tight line and Kemp can only angle the bat and steer it to cover
same again. With Franklin maintaining a tight line and McCullum standing up, Kemp's a bit limited for options
gently eased to point but it takes a vicious kick off the artificial pitch and bounces way over the fielder's head
driven right of the man at point
this time not quite aimed into the space
good take and McCullum whips the bails off just to add to the pressure
driven straight but mid on round quickly
tight line and good bowling to keep Smith tied down
on off stump, blocked
much the same line and Kemp still getting his eye in
open face and this time he finds the space on the off and uses the pace of the ball to do the rest
again Kemp finds the gap on the off
beautifully driven wide of mid off and, dew or no dew, it races to the rope. One of those where the fielder doesn't even bother to start chasing it
full length and strikes Smith on the back leg, raucous appeal but umpire Benson not interested. A sniff of an inside edge as well
played with no real aggression
clipped to mid on with a bit more oomph
pitched up and patted back
wide enough for Kemp to leave one. That's about the first he has had that luxury to
limited footwork, nipped back and he got an inside edge to an attempted drive and the ball squeezed inches past his off stump
on the spot to end a maiden over. Kemp is being kept under wraps here and that's a good maiden over
looks to force through the off side but too much bottom hand and it goes to short mid-on
ugly pull-heave but gets enough bat to bobble it to square leg. Risky on a pitch with such dodgy bounce
diving stop by Patel at midwicket
Kemp failed to time that attempted drive
much better ... in the slot and cover driven with such ease as to leave coaches the world over cooing in delight
a good reply to end Franklin's spell
that one bounced and so beat Smith's attempt to nurdle it down to third man
Ha! The TV commentator chirps how tidy McCullum has been so he drops the next one. But, in fairness, he has kept really well standing up
steered behind square on the off
straight and blocked
prodded off the outside edge to third man. Quite deliberate, quite controlled

oh dear. Smith tried to force a ball over the infield and it wasn't short enough. He was late on the shot and spooned it to Vettori who didn't have to move off the line of the fielding circle at mid off
straight on the spot
and again
Kemp can't do anything with these and he cannot afford to take any chances
a bit wider and edged drive to backward point
more flight and driven hard back at Vettori who scrambles to stop it
lovely end to a maiden ... bit and turned, kicking up dust and beating Kemp's defensive lunge
zero footwork, a spar at one outside off stump which he missed

daft single in the circumstances. Flicked to the right of midwicket and Patel made a superb diving stop on the artificial wicket and hit the stumps from a prone throw. Pollock home but it took a third-umpire referal
poodled to mid off
71.5mph - guided to third man
Pollock goes. He checked on his shot and the ball spooned gently to Patel at extra cover. They don't come easier than that.
went for the yorker, but it ended up a full toss
punched into the gap between cover and extra cover
took one step and almost converted the ball into a yorker, but dug it out with ease
again on the spot
driven to extra cover
a bit more clout and it has enough to beat the dive of extra cover
nothing doing here either. The field is tight and not allowing any gimmies
tried to run a legcutter to third man but the face of the bat was so open that it was sideways
hmm. Tried to do the same again and it came close to removing his stump as it jagged back in
played and missed again. Footwork and a desire to hit the ball to somewhere other than third man might be advisable
a few ironic cheers as Hall puts bat on ball and plays it up to mid off
and a scoring shot at last ... and no surprises as Hall runs it to third man
played at that one and theatrically withdrew his bat after the ball had gone by
really tight bowling from Vettori
up there and Hall hits it in the air over the infield. The ever-keen Patel scurries round to field inches inside the ropes
happy to block that one
read that nicely and left it alone
Vettori turned that back into Hall but he read it and blocked
Hall content to see out the over
nothing doing there. Even the crowd is slumbering and this needs some fireworks from South Africa
missed attempted glance and wobbled out on the leg side
strayed down the leg, off Hall's hip and past a diving McCullum. A rare bad ball from Oram
this is more like it. Overpitched and crisply driven all along the ground wide of extra cover
slightly cramped and run in the air through where gully would be if we had one
offcutter which Kemp patted into the covers. It's obvious that the aggression will come from Hall as Kemp struggling a little
Wide and left alone
"Oh yes Dan" chirrups McCullum to an ordinary ball safely blocked
leading edge but it lobs safely short of mid off and wide of Vettori
no risks to a decent delivery
driven uppishly to long off
worked off his toes to mid on and a scampered single
pushed through and played with ease
whoa. That turned appreciably
punched to the cover boundary
spun in but soft hands as Kemp drops and runs to point
slightly ugly drive and a tumbling stop by a sprawling midwicket
Kemp considers a run to backward point but Hall having none of it, and rightly
food and drink. overpitched and driven with power and timing through extra cover. The man on the ropes only had seven or eight yards to move but he was nowhere
Vettori back in the groove
another tight one offering nothing
a tad slower but well read
another one on the button
Vettori ends the over with another gem
quicker ball outside the off stump, defended off the back foot but no run on offer
tries to clatter this through the covers but can't get hold of it
down the pitch and hammered past the bowler to long-on who dives across and makes a fine stop
GOT HIM! Down the leg-side and turning further still, Hall chips it meekly in the air and straight to short midwicket. Dreadful stroke, and New Zealand pump their fists

pushed behind square to a short third-man who runs round and makes a great stop, picking it up with one hand and throws down the stumps. Lazy, lazy running from Petersen who only just got his bat down in time.
driven without much power into the covers

another one gone! Well flighted outside the left-hander's off stump who spoons it straight into short-leg's hands. Vettori leaps up in celebration, and is mobbed by his team-mates who all know they have this game by the throat
right up in the blockhole and defended on the front foot
well bowled again, turning away from the right hander who is comprehensively beaten
more prodigious drift and turn for Patel and half an appeal from the bowler and wicketkeeper, but it hit nothing
better aggression from the batsman this time who comes down the pitch, meets the pitch of the ball and smashes him over long-on
oops, nearly got into a tangle there...feet like concrete
a spectacular swing-and-a-miss. It's do or die, now.
well bowled! Quicker ball which hurries the batsman who jams his bat down just in time

got him! Now that's a real cracker, superbly bowled from Patel. He gave that an extra rip; the quicker ball, flatter too, and it beat the batsman all ends up. He was in no position to counter the spin, his wafty defensive, and utterly horizontal stroke making no contact and off came the bail.
comes forward with a huge stride to meet the ball and carves it out into the covers
hit with great power but straight to cover
very neatly late-cut for a scampered single. Deft stroke
jaffa! Looping, turning delivery which beat the right-hander all ends up. Lovely bowling, and tidy wicketkeeping from McCullum too
defended back to the bowler
defended once more
flatter and yorker length, Ntini uses the extra pace in the delivery to chip it over Vettori's head for a quick single...and he retains the strike

GONE and what a delivery to end this match! He ripped it hard and flat, outside the off stump and it turned quite markedly; the extra pace, as much as the spin, left Ntini no hope in defending it and it broke through the gate to remove his off bail. Terrific display of spin bowling from Patel, taking full advantage of a low, slow, crumbling pitch
